content.webTitle: UK listing of 3 less likely after Italian IPO halted

fields.headline: UK listing of 3 less likely after Italian IPO halted
fields.bodyText: The mobile phone company 3 pulled the flotation of its Italian business yesterday in a move that makes the planned listing of its UK business this year unlikely. The company, owned by the Hong Kong-based conglomerate Hutchison Whampoa, said: "Market conditions for European telecom stocks are very weak and ... the company does not believe that the market would ascribe an appropriate valuation to 3 Italia's business on its IPO at this time." Hutchison Whampoa said it would continue to support the company, having already invested €6.2bn (£4.2bn) into the 3G mobile phone business.
